shortdesc.ph: The following topics show how DITA XML constructs are represented in Markdown and MDITA, provide details on common syntax, differences between the markdown and mdita formats, and describe additional configuration options.

div.p: In 2015, the original DITA-OT Markdown plug-in introduced a series of conventions to facilitate conversion of Markdown content to DITA, and vice-versa. This Markdown flavor was called Markdown DITA, a representation of DITA content in Markdown. This format served as the foundation for the toolkitâ€™s Markdown support, and has since evolved further.

In 2017, the original Markdown plug-in was superseded by the LwDITA plug-in, which was bundled with DITA-OT 3.0, and adds additional features to support Lightweight DITA, including the MDITA format proposed in the latest specification drafts.
